intro: Ranunculus cacuminis, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers have five to eight sepals that resemble petals. It is an important plant in ecological studies due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
